com.ea.orbit.actors

Class ObserverManager<T extends IActorObserver>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ea.orbit.actors.ObserverManager<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - observable type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ObserverManager<T extends IActorObserver>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    ObserverManager is an optional thread safe collection that can be used by actors which need to call observers. ObserverManager can be persisted and send to other actors.

    Its principal utility method is the cleanup() which asynchronously removes dead observers.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addObserver

        public boolean addObserver(T observer)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if this collection changed as a result of the call.

      • cleanup

        public Task<?> cleanup()
        Pings all observers and removes the ones that no longer exist or that return an exception.

        This can take a while as some requests may timeout if the node that was holding the observer has left the cluster.

        The observer set can handle concurrent modifications.
        So it is not necessary, nor recommended, to wait on the returned Task unless the application really needs it.

        Recommended usage: 
        
 public Task activateAsync()
 {
     await(super.activateAsync());
     // intentionally not waiting for the cleanup
     state().observers.cleanup();
     return Task.done();
 }
        Returns:
        a task that will be completed when the cleanup process is finished. It's not recommended to wait on this task since it might take a while to finish the cleanup process and ObserverManager is thread safe.

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers(Consumer<T> callable)
        Used to notify the observers (call some method of their remote interface) 

         String message = "...";
 observers.notifyObservers(o -> o.receiveMessage(message));

        Parameters:
        callable - operation to be called on all observers

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Remove all observers

      • removeObserver

        public void removeObserver(T observer)
        Remove one observer
        Parameters:
        observer - observer to be removed

      • stream

        public Stream<T> stream()
        Returns a sequential Stream with this collection as its source.
        Returns:
        a sequential Stream over the elements in this collection.
